channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Stephen A Russell
item.description: When singer and actor Adam Noviello had all his work cancelled almost overnight, he pulled together a cabaret night to raise money for out-of-work artists.
item.title: Musical talents join forces for charity cabaret

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: parliament sits to consider emergency laws

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: A team could continue playing in quarantine hubs even if one of its players tests positive for COVID-19 under an early proposal related to testing outlined by the AFL to clubs on Tuesday.
item.title: AFL teams could play on in hubs even if player tests positive

item.dc:creator: Michaela Whitbourn
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Donald Trump suspends immigration into US for 60 days, Australian death toll stands at 74 as global COVID-19 cases exceed 2.5 million

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Police are ramping up their public appeal for information about missing campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay, who disappeared in the high country a month ago.
item.title: 'The bush can swallow you up': Police baffled by campers' disappearance

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.dc:creator: Riley Wilson
item.description: We have the time now to pause and reflect on how weâ€™ve been living, but more importantly to decide what we'll prioritise once all this is over.
item.title: Together, separately: how will we grow from this period of solitude?

item.description: "We have not seen a crisis like this for over a hundred years": Every tenth company boss surveyed wasn't sure whether his business can survive the pandemic.
item.title: No quick recovery: Global CEOs see U-shaped recession due to COVID-19

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.dc:creator: Lissa Christopher
item.description: The COVID-19 shutdown has staff and students improvising heavily this semester and sharing their efforts on Instagram.
item.title: National Art School students get creative in lockdown

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: The man was believed to be alone in the unit and police were trying to negotiate with him.
item.title: 'Siege': Man holed up in Gold Coast unit, smashing property with axe

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: WA Labor politician Dave Kelly has hit out at the handling by the Christian Brothers of child sex allegations against a now-deceased brother who taught him at CBC Fremantle.
item.title: WA Labor minister hits out at handling of 'terrifying' alleged child sex abuser

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: Head of COVID business taskforce is urging state and federal governments to pursue tax, regulation changes that will deliver 'immediate kicks' to the economy.
item.title: Recovery tsar eyes gas, tax and skills to get economy up and running

item.description: Anti-government demonstrators in masks and gloves maintained social distancing by protesting against government corruption from car convoys.
item.title: Seatbelts off, masks on: Lebanon's protesters shake fists from their cars

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: Wall Street's month-long rally has abruptly ended and the staggering collapse in oil prices has seemingly reawakened the bears.
item.title: Oil price plunge shatters markets' great complacency

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: CA chief Kevin Roberts has written to his counterpart at the supermarket giant to see if it can help make up for the loss of hours by cricket staff.
item.title: Going to market: Cricket Australia makes jobs plea to Woolworths for stood-down staff

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The former NRL chief executive said there will be "another chapter" in his first public statement since walking away from the game on Monday.
item.title: 'No regrets': Greenberg plans to remain NRL's 'biggest fan'

item.description: Former New England Patriots tight end turned wrestler Rob Gronkowski is set to join his former teammate Tom Brady at the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
item.title: 'I'm not totally done': Gronkowski pulls pin to reunite with Brady

item.dc:creator: Chloe Booker
item.description: Council elections should be postponed in Victoria due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the Municipal Association of Victoria says.
item.title: Councils want local elections put on ice, say 'pros outweigh the cons'

item.description: Plagued by injury and illness in recent years, Jason Day is prepared to test his limits with a marathon schedule of 11 tournaments in 13 weeks when tour golf returns.
item.title: Jason Day up for tour golf marathon

item.description: It's too easy to miss brilliant streaming shows, movies and documentaries. Here are the ones to hit play on or skip.
item.title: Need more reality TV? This streamer brings back blasts from the past

item.dc:creator: Tom McKendrick
item.description: The Last Voyage of The Pong Su, The Age and Sydney Morning Herald's investigative podcast, has won gold at the prestigious New York Festivals Radio Awards.
item.title: Pong Su wins Gold in New York

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: News of his passing last week came as a shock to former Supreme Court judge John Bryson, still very much alive.
item.title: 'No untoward event befell me': Silks on the case of mistaken identity

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: The federal government wants you to download an app. Critics say it's a surefire way to get our personal data stolen. Proponents say it will save lives. Here's the detail.
item.title: How will the coronavirus app work?

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Rising infant formula sales in China and Australia have delivered a surge in revenue for the ASX-listed company.
item.title: a2Milk sales jump amid infant formula demand in COVID-19 pandemic

item.description: Hooker Damien Cook has revealed Souths will return to club facilities for weight and fitness testing next week as the NRL prepares to resume the 2020 season.
item.title: Rabbitohs planning fitness testing next week as NRL pushes on

item.dc:creator: Dominic Powell
item.description: ACCC boss Rod Sims says motorists should shop around for the best price and send a "strong message" to petrol stations that have not yet passed on the price decreases.
item.title: ACCC directs petrol stations to pass on record-low oil prices

item.dc:creator: Heather McNeill
item.description: The expert is expected to go through the 13 critical fibres found in Bradley Edwards' old work car after it was seized from its new owner in late 2016.
item.title: Claremont killer trial LIVE: ChemCentre expert details clues found in accused's old work car 20 years after murders

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: A Childrenâ€™s Court magistrate has ordered that two young children in out-of-home care continue to have face-to-face visits with their parents despite the Department of Health and Human Services claiming it is a breach of COVID-19 regulations.
item.title: Magistrate orders children's visits with parents to continue during pandemic

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: Police set up roadblocks in surrounding streets and they tried to round up everyone who had fled the scene.
item.title: Man killed in Gold Coast stabbing, police launch homicide investigation

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The private hospital operator is looking to pay down debts and get more financial leeway as coronavirus business uncertainties remain.
item.title: Ramsay Healthcare makes $1.4 billion pitch for capital raising

item.description: Adelaide coach Matthew Nicks says his AFL club could have been more transparent about the drink-driving charge of forward Tyson Stengle.
item.title: Crows coach admits unease over Stengle

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Despite working to control a pandemic that spread from China earlier this year, Beijing has not reduced its activities in the South China Sea.
item.title: Australian, US vessels in South China Sea as China flexes muscles

item.dc:creator: Michael Idato
item.description: Cate Blanchett was determined to get under the skin of the divisive activist who helped derail the Equal Rights Amendment in Mrs America.
item.title: 'Women aren't a monolith': Blanchett wants Mrs America to spark debate

item.dc:creator: Alice Clarke
item.description: Rather than just sticking a TV in everything, the new crop of connected appliances come with actually useful smart features.
item.title: LG's latest connected white goods are smart, but not too smart

item.description: The back problem that forced the Australian to miss games after February's All-Star match has all but dissipated and he is "dying to get out there" and play.
item.title: 'Dying to get out there': Fit Simmons desperate for NBA return

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Greens councillor questions why the master plan calls for an increase in car parking, when the park is so close to buses, trains and planned new cycleways.
item.title: Too much space for cars at Brisbane's new super-park, says councillor

item.description: Trump, who has bristled at suggestions that foreign interference helped his upset 2016 victory, has sought to discredit the intelligence agencies' findings.
item.title: CIA, FBI and NSA justified in view Putin aimed to help Trump: report

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: A Perth teenager suffered severe head injuries and had to be put into an induced coma after an out-of-control car crashed into his bedroom while he was sleeping.
item.title: Perth teen suffers head injuries after car ploughs into his bedroom while he sleeps

item.description: Days after the AFLW season came to a premature end, AFL Players' Association MVP Jasmine Garner was back on the tools full time.
item.title: AFLW MVP Garner juggles footy and plumbing

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: The decision was a relief to American businesses who feared the executive order would also apply to the hundreds of thousands of temporary workers.
item.title: Only temporary: Trump suspends green cards for 60 days during pandemic

item.description: The two girls, aged 11 and 12, were swimming off a Bunbury beach on Sunday at about 10.45am when a rip swept them out to sea about 100 metres north of the Casuarina boat ramp.
item.title: 'Extremely lucky': Father rescues daughter and friend from strong rip in the South West

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The S&P/ASX 200 has risen from a morning low but is still -0.8 per cent lower. Materials are dragging.
item.title: ASX rises from morning low, as record retail figures released

item.description: Worldwide cases pass 2.5m mark amid disappointing small-scale tests on hydroxychloroquine drug.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: The world's first Environmental Protection Agency EPA was formed in 1970, exactly 50 years ago. Fifty years on Queensland remains the only Australian state without an independent EPA.
item.title: 'What century is Queensland in?' environmentalist asks over EPA

item.description: St Vincent's Hospital opens a Covid-19 test in Darlinghurst, East Sydney.
item.title: Covid-19 clinic opens in East Sydney

item.description: The transformation of "black gold" into a liability heralds a new round of deflation and financial destruction as the COVID-19 pandemic wrecks the world economy, some market participants believe.
item.title: Oil price collapse spells doom for all other assets, bears warn

item.description: Novak Djokovic has reiterated he is against taking an coronavirus vaccination if it becomes mandatory to travel once the pandemic subsides, but says he's open to changing his mind.
item.title: Djokovic reiterates anti-vax stance, but may reconsider
